### PR summary [c3e6b8f9b3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18377/commits/c3e6b8f9b3a2b8c7d847a6bf6f7c93396c29540f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.ClopenNhdofOne`|1000|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ TopologicalAddGroup.addNegClosureNhd`
`+ TopologicalGroup.mulInvClosureNhd`
`+ existOpenNormalSubgroupSubClopenNhdsOfOne`
`+ existOpenSubgroupSubClopenNhdsOfOne`
`+ exist_mul_closure_nhd`
`+ exists_mulInvClosureNhd`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

I don’t understand why you want to use definitions instead of lemmas stating existence, since what you construct is not a canonical object. Not only the result looks a bit strange, but you need to suffer with all those `Classical.choose` and `Classical.choose_spec` (by the way, you could use `Exists.choose` and `Exists.choose_spec` to get access to dot notation).

Why not finishing the main file with
```
@[to_additive]
lemma iUnion_pow {G : Type*} [Group G] {V : Set G} (einV : 1 ∈ V) :
    {x : G | ∃ n : ℕ, x ∈ V ^ n} = ⋃ n , V ^ (n + 1) := by
  …

@[to_additive "An open subgroup that is contained in a given clopen neighborhood of `1`."]
lemma OpenSubgroupSubClopenNhdsOfOne {G : Type*} [Group G] [TopologicalSpace G] [TopologicalGroup G]
    [CompactSpace G] {W : Set G} (WClopen : IsClopen W) (einW : 1 ∈ W) : 
    ∃ H : OpenSubgroup G, (H : Set G) ⊆ W := by
  rcases exists_mulInvClosureNhd WClopen with ⟨T, hT⟩
  let S : Subgroup G := {
    carrier := {x : G | ∃ n : ℕ, x ∈ T ^ n}
    mul_mem':= by
      rintro a b ⟨na, hna⟩ ⟨nb, hnb⟩
      use na + nb
      rw [pow_add]
      exact Set.mul_mem_mul hna hnb
    one_mem':= ⟨1, (by simp only [pow_one, mem_of_mem_nhds hT.nhd])⟩
    inv_mem':= by
      simp only [Set.mem_setOf_eq, forall_exists_index]
      intro x m hm
      use m
      rw [← hT.inv]
      simpa using hm }
  refine ⟨⟨S, ?_⟩, ?_⟩
  · simp only [iUnion_pow <| mem_of_mem_nhds hT.nhd]
    refine isOpen_iUnion (fun n ↦ ?_)
    rw [pow_succ]
    exact IsOpen.mul_left hT.isOpen
  · change {x : G | ∃ n : ℕ, x ∈ T ^ n} ⊆ W 
    simp_rw [iUnion_pow (mem_of_mem_nhds hT.nhd), Set.iUnion_subset_iff]
    intro n _
    have mulVpow: W * T ^ (n + 1) ⊆ W := by
      induction' n with n ih
      · simp only [zero_add, pow_one, hT.mul]
      · rw [pow_succ, ← mul_assoc]
        exact le_trans (Set.mul_subset_mul_right ih) <|
          hT.mul
    apply le_trans _ mulVpow
    intro x xin
    rw [Set.mem_mul]
    use 1, einW, x, xin
    rw [one_mul]

end TopologicalGroup
```
Note how manipulating `T` and `hT` is less painful than what you do in your version. 

By the way, if you really want to keep `iUnion_pow` then it should move to some algebra file since this has nothing to do with topology, and probably also get a more descriptive name.
The lemma `iUnion_pow` is no longer needed, thus removed, the defs and properties are now retated with lemma of existence.
Please update and improve formatting and grammar.
Why `letI` instead of `have`? This is a `Prop`, and inlining brings nothing here.

You can use generalized projections (aka dot notation) to condense all this, and also avoid explicit projection `H.1`. Something like
```
  rcases existOpenSubgroupSubClopenNhdsOfOne WClopen einW with ⟨H, hH⟩
  have : H.FiniteIndex := H.finiteIndex_of_finite_quotient
  use { toSubgroup := H.normalCore
        isOpen' := Subgroup.isOpen_of_isClosed_of_finiteIndex _ <|
          H.normalCore_isClosed <| H.isClosed }, fun _ b ↦ hH (H.normalCore_le b)
Please update and improve formatting.
Why do you keep the multiplicative name here and below in `mul`?
Those nested ⟨⟩ should not be necessary since ⟨⟩ is right-associative.
Same here.
Is there any reason to use `simp only` here? Is `simp [memW]` too slow?
Could you please use more descriptive names for those assumptions h1 to h5?
You can probably use dot notation here.
And also get rid of most pairs of ⟨⟩
Please use more descriptive names.
Again, why the `simp only`? This is a terminal `simp`, there is no need to clutter the tactic script, I would try `  · exact (h2.inter h2.inv).mem_nhds (by simp [h3])`
What about here? Does `simp` work?
It works, can be restated as `simp only [inter_mem_iff, IsOpen.mem_nhds h2 h3, inv_mem_nhds_one, and_self]`
dot notation?
What is `<|` doing here? There is no parsing ambiguity without it. And what about writing `exact (Set.mul_subset_mul_right ih).trans hV.mul` instead?
